title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· 365 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ . Photons with a wavelength of 365 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ have a higher frequency than those with a wavelength of 435 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA3@ because frequency and wavelength are inversely proportional ( ν= c λ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E65@ ). Since frequency and energy are directly proportional ( E=hν MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaWGfbGaeyypa0JaamiAaiabe27aUbaa@3D70@ ), the higher frequency (shorter wavelength) photons have the greater energy.

The response provides the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· 365 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ . Photons with a wavelength of 365 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA5@ have a higher frequency than those with a wavelength of 435 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EA3@ because frequency and wavelength are inversely proportional ( ν= c λ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E65@ ). Since frequency and energy are directly proportional ( E=hν MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaWGfbGaeyypa0JaamiAaiabe27aUbaa@3D70@ ), the higher frequency (shorter wavelength) photons have the greater energy.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Exothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration of HPR + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C49@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of reactants at elevated temperature is consistent with an exothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

The response provides the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Exothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration of HPR + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C49@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of reactants at elevated temperature is consistent with an exothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly explain why the procedure is important for an accurate measurement.

· Accurate absorbance readings depend on measuring solutions of the correct concentration. Rinsing the cuvette with some of the solution to be analyzed ensures that there is no dilution of the solution by residual water inside the cuvette, which would lead to lower measured absorbance.

The response correctly explains why the procedure is important for an accurate measurement.

· Accurate absorbance readings depend on measuring solutions of the correct concentration. Rinsing the cuvette with some of the solution to be analyzed ensures that there is no dilution of the solution by residual water inside the cuvette, which would lead to lower measured absorbance.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OCl − MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C9B@ decreases, the collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently per unit of time. The lower frequency of collisions leads to a decreased rate of product formation and correspondingly a longer half-life of the reaction.

The response provides a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OCl − MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C9B@ decreases, the collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently per unit of time. The lower frequency of collisions leads to a decreased rate of product formation and correspondingly a longer half-life of the reaction.
